concise_definition: v. 赢得, 获胜 (win 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To be victorious in a competition, contest, or game; to achieve success by outperforming others.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在竞赛、比赛或游戏中取得胜利；通过优于他人而获得成功。
definitions.example_en: She won the gold medal at the Olympic Games last year.
definitions.example_cn: 她去年在奥运会上赢得了金牌。

definitions.explanation_en: To gain or secure something desirable through effort, skill, or luck, such as an award, contract, or election.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过努力、技能或运气获得某件令人向往的事物，如奖项、合同或选举胜利。
definitions.example_en: The lawyer won the case after months of preparation.
definitions.example_cn: 这位律师经过数月的准备赢得了这场官司。

definitions.explanation_en: To earn or be awarded something as a result of merit or performance, often in a formal or public context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因表现优异或功绩而在正式或公开场合中获得某物。
definitions.example_en: He won the Nobel Prize for his groundbreaking research in physics.
definitions.example_cn: 他因在物理学领域的开创性研究而获得了诺贝尔奖。

comparison.analysis: “Beat” (击败) 强调在对抗中战胜某个具体对手，常用于直接竞争关系，如“beat someone in a match”。而 “won” 更侧重于结果——赢得比赛、奖项或胜利本身，不一定强调对手是谁。例如，可以说 “won the championship”，但不能说 “beat the championship”。
“Earned” (赢得/获得) 强调通过努力、付出或符合资格而获得回报，带有道德或价值判断，如“earned respect”。而 “won” 更多用于竞争性或偶然性情境，如赢得彩票或比赛，不一定体现持续努力。
“Secured” (确保获得) 指通过策略、安排或保障措施使某物最终属于己方，常用于非竞争性语境，如“secured a contract”或“secured funding”。而 “won” 暗示存在竞争或挑战，结果是通过击败他人或克服障碍获得的。
